message.content: This question requires knowledge about the relative hardness of substances. The Mohs hardness scale is commonly used to measure the hardness of minerals. Diamond is ranked at the top of the scale with a hardness of 10, while Play-Doh is a soft, malleable material that can be easily scratched. So, when diamond can scratch Play-Doh, it indicates that diamond is harder than Play-Doh. Option (A) is incorrect because Play-Doh cannot scratch diamond. Option (B) is incorrect because diamond can scratch Play-Doh, not the other way around. Option (D) is also incorrect because Play-Doh cannot scratch diamond.

This question requires knowledge about the Mohs scale of mineral hardness. The Mohs scale ranks minerals based on their ability to scratch other minerals. Diamond is ranked as the hardest mineral and can scratch Play-Doh, which is a soft material. Therefore, option (C) is correct. Option (A) is incorrect because Play-Doh cannot scratch diamond, as diamond is the harder material. Option (B) is incorrect because we are looking for the relationship that describes the hardness of the substances, not the reverse. Option (D) is incorrect for the same reason as option (A).

This question requires knowledge about the Mohs scale of hardness, which is used to compare the hardness of different materials. The Mohs scale assigns a value from 1 to 10, with 1 being the softest and 10 being the hardest. Diamond is the hardest material on the Mohs scale with a value of 10, while Play-Doh is a soft and malleable material with a value of less than 1.

Option (A) is incorrect because Play-Doh cannot scratch diamond, as diamond is harder. Option (B) is incorrect because diamond can scratch Play-Doh, indicating that diamond is harder. Option (D) is incorrect for the same reason as option (A). Option (C) is the correct answer because diamond can scratch Play-Doh, indicating that diamond is harder.

This question requires knowledge about the relative hardness of materials. The Mohs Scale of Hardness ranks minerals and materials based on their ability to scratch other materials. Diamond is at the top of the scale with a hardness of 10, while Play-Doh is a soft and malleable material that can easily be scratched by harder substances. Option (A) is incorrect because Play-Doh cannot scratch diamond. Option (B) is incorrect because if diamond can scratch Play-Doh, it means diamond is harder, not Play-Doh. Option (D) is incorrect for the same reason as option (A).

This question requires some knowledge about the relative hardness of materials. The relationship between hardness is determined by the ability of one material to scratch another. In this case, the relationship is "diamond can scratch Play-Doh, therefore diamond is harder." This is because diamond is one of the hardest materials known, whereas Play-Doh is relatively soft and can be easily scratched by diamond. Options (A) and (D) are incorrect because Play-Doh cannot scratch diamond, so it cannot be considered harder than diamond. Option (B) is also incorrect because diamond can scratch Play-Doh, indicating that diamond is harder.
